e4: Maintaining the current policy, while seemingly beneficial in the short-term, is ethically problematic.  The long-term benefits of transparency and building trust with investors outweigh the potential short-term market volatility.  A shift to the new policy, while requiring careful communication, establishes a foundation of integrity for the company.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy.  It should present a fair and unbiased view of the company's financial performance, avoiding any manipulation or intentional misrepresentation.  All material information should be disclosed to allow investors to make informed decisions, regardless of potential short-term market impacts.  Consistency and adherence to established accounting standards are also crucial.
e6: I would ask about their plan to communicate the policy change to investors, including specific messaging strategies to mitigate potential negative market reactions.  I'd also want to understand their assessment of the potential impact on different investor groups (retail vs. institutional) and how they will address any perceived inequalities.
